Package Game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
This class represents the game. It implements Serializable interface to support serialization.

  • Field Details

    • mill

      public java.util.ArrayList<MillContainer> mill

    • millHelper

      public MillHelper millHelper

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(Token token)
      Constructor for the Game class. Initializes two players, assigns tokens to them, sets the initial turn to player 1, and creates the game board.
      Parameters:
      token - The token to be assigned to player 2.

  • Method Details

    • initMill

      public void initMill()
      Initializes the mill with predefined mill containers. Each mill container represents a combination of positions forming a mill on the game board.

    • hasMill

      public boolean hasMill​(Board board, Player currentTurn)
      Checks if the current player has formed a mill on the game board. If a mill is formed, it updates the millHelper data structures to track mills and returns true.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      currentTurn - The current player's turn.
      Returns:
      True if the current player has formed a mill, false otherwise.

    • deletePiece

      public void deletePiece​(Board board, Player player, int index, Game game)
      Deletes a piece from the board and updates the player's piece count. If the deleted piece was in a mill, it updates mill information on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      player - The player who is deleting the piece.
      index - The index of the position on the board where the piece is deleted.
      game - The current game.

    • botPlace

      public int botPlace​(Game game)
      Places a token for the bot on the game board. The bot randomly selects an available position until it successfully places a token.
      Parameters:
      game - The current game.
      Returns:
      The index of the position where the bot placed its token, or -1 if unsuccessful.

    • place

      public boolean place​(int to, Token token, Game game, Player player)
      Places a token on the game board for the specified player. Checks if the position is available and the player has remaining pieces. If conditions are met, places the token on the board and updates player's piece counts.
      Parameters:
      to - The index of the position where the token is to be placed.
      token - The token to be placed (either Player1 or bot).
      game - The current game.
      player - The player for whom the token is being placed.
      Returns:
      True if the token is successfully placed, false otherwise.

    • canMove

      public void canMove​(Game game, int from, int to, Player player)
      Moves a player's token from one position to another on the game board. Handles mill information if the starting position is in a mill.
      Parameters:
      game - The current game.
      from - The index of the position where the token is currently located.
      to - The index of the position where the token is to be moved.
      player - The player making the move.

    • getCurrentTurn

      public Player getCurrentTurn()
      Gets the player whose turn it currently is.
      Returns:
      The player whose turn it currently is.

    • setCurrentTurn

      public void setCurrentTurn​(Player currentTurn)
      Sets the player whose turn it currently is in the game.
      Parameters:
      currentTurn - The player whose turn it should be set to.

    • getPlayer1

      public Player getPlayer1()
      Gets the player representing Player 1 in the game.
      Returns:
      The player representing Player 1.

    • getPlayer2

      public Player getPlayer2()
      Gets the player representing Player 2 in the game.
      Returns:
      The player representing Player 2.

    • setPlayer2

      public void setPlayer2​(Player player2)
      Sets the player representing Player 2 in the game.
      Parameters:
      player2 - The player object representing Player 2.

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Gets the game board object.
      Returns:
      The game board object.

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard​(Board board)
      Sets the game board object.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board object to be set.
